translations.translation: and He will admit them into the Garden which He has made known to them.
And will admit them into gardens with which he has acquainted them.
and will admit them to Paradise with which He has acquainted them.
He will admit them into the Paradise which He has made known to them.
And He will admit them into Paradise – they have been made familiar with it.
And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.
And cause them to enter the garden which He has made known to them.
and He will admit them to Paradise, that He has made known to them.
And bring them in unto the Garden which He hath made known to them.
He will admit them into the Garden He has already made known to them.
And He shall make them enter the Garden; He shall have made it known, Unto them.
and admit them into paradise, with which He has acquainted them.
And admit them to the Garden which He has announced for them.
And admit them to Paradise which He has made known to them (i.e. they will know their places in Paradise more than they used to know their houses in the world).
and He will admit them to the Paradise He has made known to them.
And will admit them into Paradise, which He has identified for them.
And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

[47:6] And He will admit them into Paradise, which He has made known, [which] He has pointed out, to them, so that they are guided to their dwellings in it, and to their spouses and servants without asking to be shown the way.
(And bring them in unto the Garden which He hath made known to them) He will indicate it for them such that they are guided to it, just as in the life of the world they know how to find their homes.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { عَرَّفَهَا لَهُمْ } معناه بيَّنها لَهُم، وعَرَّفهم منازِلَهم

translations.translation: And His saying, {He made it known to them}, means He explained it to them, and He made them aware of their ranks.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَيُدْخِلُهُمُ ٱلْجَنَّةَ } التي { عَرَّفَهَا لَهُمْ } [محمد: 6] حين أمرهم بالجهاد
 ألا وهي الحياة الأزلية الأبدية الإلهية الموعودة للشهداء من عنده سبحانه بقوله:
[آل عمران: 169]


{ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُوۤاْ إِن تَنصُرُواْ ٱللَّهَ } يعني: دينه ورسوله { يَنصُرْكُمْ } على أعدائكم { وَيُثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَكُمْ } [محمد: 7] في جادة توحيده وصراط تحقيقهز

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ ويُدخلهم الجنةَ عَرَّفها لهم }
 قال مجاهد: عرّفهم مساكنهم فيها حتى لا يحتاجوا إلى دليل لها
 أو: طَيَّبها
 من: العَرف
 وهو طيب الرائحة
 ويمكن الجمع: بأن عَرْف المحل يهدي صاحبَه إلى جنته ومحله
 { يا أيها الذين آمنوا إِن تنصروا اللهَ } بنصر دينه وإظهار شريعة نبيه { ينصركمْ } على عدوكم
 ويفتح لكم
